name: UPaperSprite
doc:
Sprite Asset

Stores the data necessary to render a single 2D sprite (from a region of a texture)
Can also contain collision shapes for the sprite.

@see UPaperSpriteComponent

OriginInSourceImageBeforeTrimming: Origin within SourceImage, prior to atlasing
bTrimmedInSourceImage: This texture is trimmed, consider the values above
bRotatedInSourceImage: This texture is rotated in the atlas
SourceTextureDimension:
Dimension of the texture when this sprite was created
Used when the sprite is resized at some point
SourceTexture: The source texture that the sprite comes from
AdditionalSourceTextures: Additional source textures for other slots
DefaultMaterial: The material to use on a sprite instance if not overridden (this is the default material when only one is being used, and is the translucent/masked material for Diced render geometry, slot 0)
AlternateMaterial: The alternate material to use on a sprite instance if not overridden (this is only used for Diced render geometry, and will be the opaque material in that case, slot 1)
Sockets: List of sockets on this sprite
PixelsPerUnrealUnit: The scaling factor between pixels and Unreal units (cm) (e.g., 0.64 would make a 64 pixel wide sprite take up 100 cm)
CustomPivotPoint: Custom pivot point (relative to the sprite rectangle)
bSnapPivotToPixelGrid: Should the pivot be snapped to a pixel boundary?
CollisionGeometry: Custom collision geometry polygons (in texture space)
CollisionThickness: The extrusion thickness of collision geometry when using a 3D collision domain
RenderGeometry: Custom render geometry polygons (in texture space)
AtlasGroup: Spritesheet group that this sprite belongs to
